title: Leonard, Mills lead Spurs by Grizzlies for 3-2 series lead
title_page: Leonard, Mills lead Spurs by Grizzlies for 3-2 series lead | Daily Mail Online
text:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) - Kawhi Leonard had 28 points and the San Antonio Spurs rebounded from two discouraging road losses to beat the Memphis Grizzlies 116-103 on Tuesday night and take a 3-2 lead in their first-round NBA playoff series.
San Antonio shot 14 for 28 on 3-point attempts, two off its postseason record, including 5-for-7 shooting by Patty Mills.
Mills finished with 20 points and Tony Parker added 16.
San Antonio Spurs guard Manu Ginobili (20) grabs a loose ball in front of Memphis Grizzlies guard Vince Carter (15) during the first half of Game 5 in a first-round NBA basketball playoff series, Tuesday, April 25, 2017, in San Antonio. (AP Photo/Eric Gay)
Mike Conley had 26 points and Marc Gasol added 17 for the Grizzlies, who have lost nine straight postseason games in San Antonio.
With each team winning on its homecourt, Game 6 is Thursday night in Memphis.
San Antonio Spurs guard Jonathon Simmons (17) shoots over Memphis Grizzlies center Marc Gasol (33) during the first half of Game 5 in a first-round NBA basketball playoff series, Tuesday, April 25, 2017, in San Antonio. (AP Photo/Eric Gay)
San Antonio Spurs head coach Gregg Popovich argues a call during the first half of Game 5 in a first-round NBA basketball playoff series against the Memphis Grizzlies, Tuesday, April 25, 2017, in San Antonio. (AP Photo/Eric Gay)
San Antonio Spurs forward Kawhi Leonard (2) drives around Memphis Grizzlies forward James Ennis III, center, during the first half of Game 5 in a first-round NBA basketball playoff series, Tuesday, April 25, 2017, in San Antonio. (AP Photo/Eric Gay)
San Antonio Spurs guard Danny Green (14) reacts after scoring against the Memphis Grizzlies during the first half of Game 5 in a first-round NBA basketball playoff series, Tuesday, April 25, 2017, in San Antonio. (AP Photo/Eric Gay)
